name: Bryn Howel Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights on 6th and 7th Feb,and found this to be a lovely hotel.The setting is wonderfull,with the hotel set in lovely countryside.The standard of the room was very good,very clean with a great over bath shower.The views from the window were fantastic.The food was very good and to eat in a dining room looking out onto a walled garden with views beyond to the Welsh hills was marvelous.The breakfast was very well cooked and I think everyone would be well catered for.The staff were very friendly and helpfull.The one and only thing that could be improved is the choice of beer in the bar,just the usual hotel smoothflow type beer available which if you enjoy a good ale is very dissapointing.The bar is a lovely place with a big log fire and winged back chairs where we would have spent a lot more time if the ale choice had been better.But that is a small thing compared to the rest of the hotel.We were very lucky with the weather,which was icy cold but brilliant clear blue sky,which made the setting even more lovely.We would without doubt stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both myself and my wife stayed for Valentines nigt here £99.99 for a night stay and a fab valentines meal. The room was lovely and the grounds were big. Brekfast was also good and staff throughout our stay couldn't have been nicer. A lovely hotel and we look forward to staying again this time in the summer.
reviews.title: valentines night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: This hotel must have peaked in terms of refurbishment about 30 years ago, but it still offers a very pleasant experience in the beautiful Vale of Llangollen. The winter offer of B&B for £10 pp if you eat the £25 dinner (ie £70 D, B & B for 2) is excellent value for money, but £25 for dinner would not by itself represent value.
reviews.title: Fading beauty offers excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is warm, clean and comfortable. Restaurant food fresh and compotently cooked
reviews.title: Nice hotel, beautiful grounds, average breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Saw in the local paper that the hotel is up for sale - if the new owners invest in refurbishment the hotel could warrant higher ratings.
reviews.title: Excellent Wedding Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for the same room as previously but had to take another as it was already booked. We seemed to be in a honeymoon room by the style of the soft furnishings. It was bigger and better than the one we loved before. The food is always excellent here. We have returned and will do so again. We love walking and this hotel has plenty of walks on the doorstep whether you want Offa's Dyke Walk, the Berwyn Mountains, the Llangollen Panorama walk or flat lowland and canal towpath walking.
reviews.title: Always very welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There are plenty of activities in the area. The rooms are excellent. The food is excellent. If you decide to pay a visit do not take up our space when we next visit. That is my greatest fear about this place. It is so good and provides value for money.
reviews.title: Lovely short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a good break along with a number of friends at the Bryn Howel.It was situated by the canal which was accessable through the hotel grounds and was a good two and a half miles into town.The views were scenic and we enjoyed watching the boats.
reviews.title: a stay with friends at Bryn Howel Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was good value,food excellent along with the service.We could not fault our room as it was warm and comfortable.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a higher floor and maybe the stairway and curtains here may benefit from an update...on the whole the stay was pleasurable,reasonable and good,would recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely but needs a little TLC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Have now made 3 trips to the hotel on special offer breaks so they must be doing something right! The highlight is the evening meal in the delightful restaurant overlooking the fabulous gardens. Great menu with a wide choice to cater for all tastes. Breakfasts (hot and cold buffet style) are more than adequate though not up to the high class standard of evening meals. Top tip: take an asbestos glove with you down to breakfast, the serviettes are not adequate to hold the extremely hot plates safely!!The bedrooms are fairly large and quite comfortable, but don't expect top quality luxury and you won't be disappointed. Great that the spa facilities at the sister hotel (the pheasant) down the road are available free of charge. We shall return on an offer break again, if only for the evening meals!
reviews.title: Lovely breakaway treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time at this hotel it gets better under the keen eye of Patrick in the resturant the service is perfect the food is out of this world, very good Chef.
reviews.title: not to be missed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a little shabby but I understand is being bought so hopefully the new owners will rectify this fault, but everything considered, staff food drinks and price is perfect.
reviews.title: Return to Bryn Howell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will certainly return cannot wait
reviews.title: bryn howel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Return visit to Bryn Howell.Nice friendly hotel,Staff lovely!!Stayed 2nights. Managed to get deal with dinner. Lovely setting with walks near canal. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: A Jem in North Wales

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Bryn Howel for a few nights having found it decent offer for £55 a night, the hotel is in a beautiful location outside of Llangollen, with amazing views from the main dining room, and the garden.
reviews.title: Ticks all the right boxes for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was quite large, with all the usual amenities, very clean albeit a little dated. The staf was generally very accomodating and friendly, and we enjoyed some bar food which was really a pleasant surprise in that it was both tasty and affordable.
reviews.title: Lovely old fashioned hotel located on the canal in Trevor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was one of the best we've ever had the pleasure of enjoying, the sausages were simply amazing, and there was even black pudding available.
reviews.title: in need of tlc beware room 35

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only drawbacks where things looking a little tired around the edges, flaking paint here and there, and we had the smallest CRT TV I've seen in quite some time in our room. Perhaps a lick of paint and investing in some flatscreen TV's would just give it that little extra.
reviews.title: excellent !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still, for the money definitely worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely olde world hotel and experience.

description: Bryn Howel Hotel the most perfect setting for your perfect day, Set in the spectacular Dee Valley, alongside the Llangollen Canal absolutely outstanding views, Our aim is to provide perfect service and excellent food to all guests regardless of your choice of dining be it in our famous lounge bar with its oak wood paneled surround and blazing open fire, to the amazing Ceder Tree Restaurant both of which have undergone major investment. Our award winning team of chefs are here to cater for your requirements, What ever they may be. The service team have undergone intense training to ensure your requirements are carried out to the letter, we pride our reputation on our standards of service, refer to Facebook or TripAdvisor for your satisfaction.
